Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with part of rosette in added white; below, single white band; exterior: reserved.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5 (Register)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to the museum's pottery ledger, this deaccessioned object was discovered among other objects in a deposit within the Aphrodite sanctuary.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1188) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5919 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
